1:
Blessed is the person whose transgression is forgiven,\q whose sin is covered.
\q
2:
Blessed is the man to whom Yahweh reckons no guilt\q and in whose spirit there is no deceit.


\q
3:
When I remained silent, my bones were wasting away\q while I groaned all day long.
\q
4:
For day and night your hand was heavy upon me.\q My strength withered as in summer drought.
\qs Selah\qs*


\q
5:
Then I acknowledged my sin to you,\q and I no longer hid my iniquity.
\q I said, "I will confess my transgressions to Yahweh,"
\q and you forgave the guilt of my sin.
\qs Selah\qs*
\q
6:
Because of this, all who are godly should pray to you at a time of great distress.\q Then when the surging waters overflow, they will not reach those people.


\q
7:
You are my hiding place; you will guard me from trouble.\q You will surround me with the songs of victory.
\qs Selah\qs*
\q
8:
I will instruct you and teach you in the way which you should go.\q I will instruct you with my eye upon you.


\q
9:
Do not be like a horse or like a mule, which have no understanding;\q it is only with bridle and bit to control them
\q that they will go where you want them to.
\q
10:
The wicked have many sorrows,\q but Yahweh's covenant faithfulness will surround the one who trusts in him.


\q
11: Be glad in Yahweh, and rejoice, you righteous;\q shout for joy, all you who are upright in heart.
